QuestionStem: Which statement(s) most accurately summarizes the number of white flowers in each generation of offspring?

options.AnswerText: A. The second generation has more white flowered plants than the first generation.
B. The second generation has the same proportion of white flowered plants as the parent generation.
C. The first generation has no white flowered plants, while one-fourth of the second generation has white flowered plants.
D. The first generation has no white flowered plants, while the second generation has mostly white flowered plants.

CorrectFeedback: The first generation offspring all have purple flowers. In the second generation, most plants have purple flowers, but one out of four second-generation offspring have white flowers.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: Look again at the data set. Notice that all of the first generation offspring have purple flowers; none have white flowers. Then, look at the second generation of offspring. What proportion of that generation has white flowers?
IncorrectFeedback: Look again at the data set. Notice that all of the first generation offspring have purple flowers; none have white flowers. Then, look at the second generation of offspring. What proportion of that generation has white flowers?
FinalIncorrectFeedback: The first generation offspring all have purple flowers. In the second generation, most plants have purple flowers, but one out of four second-generation offspring have white flowers.
